name: Worlds Apart
description:
This game is made for a Artgame Design module in NUS.

It was designed to explore the potential of games as art—provoking introspection beyond the game world.

Artist Statement: "Oftentimes when troubles arise and you feel that lack of goal or meaning in life, the easy way out is to distract yourself with the things out there. While sometimes pretending your problems aren’t there works, other times they come back and hit you harder than before. Perhaps it is better to face your problems. Acknowledging them is the first step to conquering them. This game attempts to make a commentary on that."
